result.execSummary:
The defendant Samantha L. Horne was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Samantha L. Horne is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Samantha L. Horne was found guilty of Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*   Pay fine of $300 and court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
Perform   150   hours of community service for a public agency or a nonprofit charitable organization.  May not associate with gangs/gang members or gang affiliations.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  No association w/ any indiviuals who use or traffic in controlled substances.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Defendant, Samantha L. Horne, appeared with Attorney Lauren Breckenfelder specially for Attorney Komp.  Clerk: PT
Sentencing arguments made.    Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.  Sentence is withheld and DE is placed on probation for 18 months with conditions. As a condition she is ordered to complete 150 hours of community service.   Court imposes a fine of $300 plus costs & surcharge to be paid during supervision.  Any unpaid financial obligations that remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning and Voting Acknowledgement given.
Sentencing rescheduled to 5/24 at 2:00 PM and Atty Breckenfelder to provide notice to defendant.
Email correspondence received from Atty Breckenfelder requesting to reschedule today's hearing as she will be in a jury trial.  Court has reviewed and approves request.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Defendant, Samantha L. Horne, appeared with Atty Lauren Breckenfelder specially for Atty Angela Komp.  Clerk; PT
Atty Breckenfelder states she just received a copy of the PSI before court so she is not prepared to proceed today.  Sentencing adjourned to May 3, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty Angela Komp.  Counts 1 and 2 - Dismissed on State motion.  Count 3 - Plea of guilty; found guilty by the Court.  Presentence investigation ordered.  Sentencing 4/14/16 at 10:00.  Bond continued.  (Per Atty Komp, def. is serving a sentence which ends on 2/15/16.  If released from jail on 2/15/16, court orders def. to report to Probation & Parole re PSI by 4 PM on 2/16/16.)

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney A Komp.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Komp's suppression motion.  Testimony taken from:  Twin Lakes Police Officer Stanley St. Clair.  Court denies suppression motion for reasons set forth on the record.  Atty Komp states she believes the case will resolve.  FPT set for 2/10/16 at 9:10am.  Bond continued.
To suppress - filed by Atty. Angela Komp
Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Angela Komp.  Motion to Suppress scheduled for 1/20/16 @ 3:30.  Clerk D. Smith.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty Angela Komp.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Atty Komp requests time to view the squad video and to discuss new plea offer with def.  FPT 12/22/15 at 8:50.  Bond continued.

Defendant Samantha L. Horne appeared with Attorney Angela Komp.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JThwing. Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found. Bound over to Br 8.  Information filed, reading waived. Not guilty pleas entered. Bond continued.  Final pre-trial scheduled for December 1, 2015 at 09:30 am.
